User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account for the AI Habitual application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user entity.

username.description: The user's username, used for login.

registrationDate.description: The date and time when the user registered.

Habit.title: Habit
Habit.description: Represents a habit that a user is tracking.

completions.description: A map where keys are date strings (e.g., '2024-05-21') and values are the number of times the habit was completed on that day.

targetCompletions.description: How many times per day a habit should be completed. Defaults to 1 if not set.

definition.description: Stores user account information.  Authorization is based on the path `/users/{userId}`, where `userId` must match `request.auth.uid`.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user, corresponding to the Firebase Authentication UID.

definition.description: Stores habits for a specific user. Authorization ensures that only the user can access their own habits.

params.name: habitId
params.description: The unique ID for the habit.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage user accounts and their habits for the AI Habitual application. The `/users/{userId}` path stores public user profile information, with security rules ensuring that only the authenticated user can modify their own data. The subcollection `/users/{userId}/habits/{habitId}` stores the habits for each user, ensuring data isolation and security. This path-based ownership strategy provides strong security guarantees, simplifies security rules, and enables efficient querying of a user's own habits without complex lookups.
